meanings.definition: Having the taste or smell of onions.
meanings.sent1: The soup was so oniony that it made my eyes water.
meanings.sent2: The salad dressing was slightly oniony, adding a nice kick to the dish.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally used an oniony candle in the kitchen, and now everything smells like a giant salad!
meanings.sent4: The air in the kitchen was thick and oniony, making it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent5: The oniony aroma filled the room, making everyone crave a savory meal.

meanings.definition: Resembling an onion in flavor or aroma.
meanings.sent1: The dish had a unique oniony taste that reminded me of my favorite vegetable.
meanings.sent2: The sauce had an oniony undertone that added depth to the overall flavor.
meanings.sent3: The oniony perfume I bought smelled so realistic that I kept craving a salad.
meanings.sent4: The oniony scent wafted through the room, creating a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The oniony essence of the dish lingered on my taste buds, leaving a pleasant aftertaste.
